truth: -  "Health economics is a branch of economics concerned with issues related to efficiency, effectiveness, value and behavior in the production and consumption of health and healthcare."
fiction: -  "Health economics is a branch of economics concerned with issues related to the production and consumption of health potions and magical cures."

truth: -  "In health economics, the term 'moral hazard' refers to the increased consumption of healthcare services when the cost of healthcare is covered by insurance."
fiction: -  "In health economics, the term 'moral hazard' refers to the risk of doctors turning evil when they are not paid enough."

truth: -  "Cost-effectiveness analysis is a form of economic analysis that compares the relative costs and outcomes (effects) of different courses of action in healthcare."
fiction: -  "Cost-effectiveness analysis is a form of economic analysis that compares the relative costs and outcomes of different flavors of hospital cafeteria food."

truth: -  "Healthcare markets are often characterized by market failures, such as information asymmetry between the provider and the patient."
fiction: -  "Healthcare markets are often characterized by market failures, such as the inability to buy and sell patients on the open market."

truth: -  "The demand for healthcare is considered to be a derived demand, meaning it is demanded because of the need for good health, not for its own sake."
fiction: -  "The demand for healthcare is considered to be a derived demand, meaning it is demanded because of the need for a good vacation, not for its own sake."

truth: -  "The World Health Organization (WHO) plays a crucial role in global health economics, setting standards and helping countries to finance healthcare."
fiction: -  "The World Health Organization (WHO) plays a crucial role in global health economics, setting the price for every medical procedure worldwide."

truth: -  "Health insurance is a form of insurance coverage that pays for medical and surgical expenses incurred by the insured."
fiction: -  "Health insurance is a form of insurance coverage that pays for gym memberships and personal trainers."

truth: -  "Pharmaceutical economics, a sub-field of health economics, deals with issues related to the cost and value of drugs and other medical treatments."
fiction: -  "Pharmaceutical economics, a sub-field of health economics, deals with issues related to the cost and value of magic potions and herbal remedies."

truth: -  "In health economics, 'out-of-pocket' costs refer to the portion of the healthcare costs that the insured party must pay directly from their own pocket."
fiction: -  "In health economics, 'out-of-pocket' costs refer to the money that doctors occasionally lose from their coat pockets while on duty."

truth: -  "Healthcare providers are institutions or individuals providing healthcare services. They can be specialized in various medical fields and sectors."
fiction: -  "Healthcare providers are institutions or individuals providing musical services in hospitals. They can be specialized in various musical genres."

truth: -  "Public health interventions are often cost-effective and represent a good use of resources, according to health economics."
fiction: -  "Public health interventions are often a good opportunity to sell popcorn and represent a good use of marketing resources, according to health economics."

truth: -  "Economic evaluations in healthcare often involve comparing the cost and quality of different healthcare interventions."
fiction: -  "Economic evaluations in healthcare often involve comparing the cost and quality of different hospital bed sheets."

truth: -  "Health technology assessment (HTA) is a multidisciplinary process that uses explicit methods to determine the value of a health technology at different points in its lifecycle."
fiction: -  "Health technology assessment (HTA) is a process that uses explicit methods to determine the value of a doctor's stethoscope at different points in its lifecycle."
